TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit OutputCache extends System.Object
public ref class OutputCache abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides programmatic access to the output-cache providers that are specified in the configuration file for a Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Output caching stores the generated output of pages, controls, and HTTP responses in memory. Output caching enables you to cache different versions of content depending on the query string and on form-post parameters to a page, on browser type, or on the language of the user. You can configure ASP.NET to cache an output-cache entry for a specific period. You can also configure ASP.NET to evict a cache entry automatically based on an external event such as changes in the database that the cache depends on.
The <xref:System.Web.Caching.OutputCache> class enables you to extend output caching. For example, you can configure one or more custom output-cache providers that target other storage devices such as local or remote disks, databases, cloud storage, and distributed cache engines.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property DefaultProviderName As String
public: static property System::String ^ DefaultProviderName { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the name of the default provider that is configured for the output cache.
Docs.value: The name of the default provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks By default, all HTTP responses, rendered pages, and controls use `AspNetInternalProvider`, the in-memory output cache provider. To use a different provider, set the `defaultProvider` attribute to the name of the alternative provider.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig object Deserialize(class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

Docs.summary: Deserializes a binary object into output-cache data.
Docs.returns: An object that contains the deserialized data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
[!INCLUDE [untrusted-data-method-note](~/includes/untrusted-data-method-note.md)]
This method is used by output-cache providers that are operating under partial trust.

Docs.exception: The deserialized object that is returned by the method is not a valid output-cache type.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Shared ReadOnly Property Providers As OutputCacheProviderCollection

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of the output-cache providers that are specified in the configuration file for a Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You configure one or more custom output-cache providers that target other storage devices, such as local or remote disks, databases, cloud storage, and distributed cache engines. To configure custom output-cache providers, you add a provider to the collection that is represented by the <xref:System.Web.Caching.OutputCache.Providers%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Serialize (System.IO.Stream stream, object data);
.method public static hidebysig void Serialize(class System.IO.Stream stream, object data) cil managed
public: static void Serialize(System::IO::Stream ^ stream, System::Object ^ data);
static member Serialize : System.IO.Stream * obj -> unit

Docs.param: The object to contain the serialized binary data.
Docs.summary: Serializes output-cache data into binary data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used by output-cache providers that are operating under partial trust.

Docs.exception: is not one of the specified output-cache types.
